description: From Sanskrit क्षत्रिय (kṣatriya, “protector of gentle people”), from क्षत्र (kṣatra, “rule, dominion, authority”). Akin to satrap.

entries.meaning: The second-highest of the four castes or varnas in traditional Hindu society: the warrior or military caste.

examples: The kshatriya could only hope to become a monk in his next life, but given the nature of his daily karma, it seemed unlikely that he could achieve even this limited goal.
